website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive moisture in the form of potent and pure grapeseed essential oil, sourced from the world over.
pros: Contains all-natural grapeseed oil, sourced with care and thought to sustainability from regions all around the world
Essential oil is tested to verify its purity and quality before being distributed
Bottle has easy application and spill control
cons: The efficacy of grapeseed oil on special skin problems has not been verified, so product may be limited to moisturizing and nourishing, and not help issues like eczema, scars, etc

customer_reviews.title: GReat for hair and face
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to coat my 3c curly hair after my leave in to seal in the moisture. And on my face twice a week as a moisturizer after my derma roller. My skin is plumper for sure but also well moisturized without being oily. Literally a few drops is all you need before bed at night on your face
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Mild fragrance is perfect for my sensitive nose.  Not too greasy.  We use this as massage oil.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I use this grapeseed oil as massage oil. It is not too greasy. The scent is very mild. I am very sensitive to fragrances and this oil has very little scent. The bottle is easy to open and it the lid snaps shut in a tight seal so if it accidentally gets bumped or tips over it won't spill out. We've taken it with us on the airplane (in our checked luggage) and had no problems with it opening and spilling.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Working Mom in California

customer_reviews.title: was expecting more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as recommendation for fine wrinkles. its good but not the best for this purpose
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: na
customer_reviews.text: The oil stick on my skin and make my skin sticky
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Perez

customer_reviews.title: Not as light as I thought
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using this product however I think its too oily for my skin. At this point in the season though it may be too early for me to use an oil. I will hold off on using it again until the Fall/Winter when my skin gets a lot drier.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P.

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product I really enjoyed it. The price was affordable. Thank you very much. Will purchase again
customer_reviews.author: cam bridges

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best for dry skin! Makes skin very shiny, so I recommend using for night time routine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My face did not like it. Gave it to a friend to try.
customer_reviews.author: Judy M

customer_reviews.title: great oil
customer_reviews.text: Used this oil for my hair and it does not leave a greasy feel nor has a smell to it,
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Good for the skin and has lots of other uses as well. I use it for a moisturized after working outside.
customer_reviews.author: W. Truax

customer_reviews.title: Leakage and no cap
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but the bottle had no cap and 1/4th of the oil from the bottle leaked and the box that it was packed in with other stuffs I had ordered were a mess from this leaked oil.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anburaj

customer_reviews.title: don't be fooled
customer_reviews.text: the photo on this listing shows a bottle labelled `Sweet Almond Oil' which is what I was looking for - lo and behold it's not almond oil it's just plain grapeseed oil, not remotely the same! the listing is misleading, why are they showing almond oil in the photo when that isn't what they're selling?? very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyH

customer_reviews.title: Cap Problems ;-/
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint like others have had- the cap squirts out a large amount each time, which can be wasteful. Often have to unscrew the cap completely to get the little amount that I need, which can get annoying. If you can get past the cap in glides in the hair beautifully
customer_reviews.author: Chic Psychic

customer_reviews.title: Grapeseed Oil
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by a doctor on television as the only product you need for your face. I use it at night as a moisturizer and have used on burns and scars. I do not like the flip-top opening because it allows too much oil to flow when you least expect it. Great product to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: C. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Great Massage Oil--Doesn't Dry Out Quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent all around oil. For massage purposes, it doesn't dry out or get absorbed quickly, so its lubricating qualities are superb.
customer_reviews.author: Will Corsair

customer_reviews.title: Good but I don't like the dispenser
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great. I love it and use it for both moisturizing and makeup removal. I gave it 4 stars because the dispenser shoots too much oil out. I normally unscrew that top and just use it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as stated
customer_reviews.text: I got this after hearing it recommended on the Dr. Oz show for dark circles and cellulite. I've only had it a few days so I don't know if it is doing anything yet, but I'm hopeful!~!
customer_reviews.author: Qtpi

customer_reviews.title: So many uses!
customer_reviews.text: This oil works perfect for my skin....also I add few drops of grapefruit oil and use it god my hair. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: TINA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, is extremely smooth and clear. Love how easily it gets into the skin. Very happy. Mrs. Armstrong
customer_reviews.author: John Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Using it now as a natural substitute for moisturizer which is expensive. It is working nicely and lot cheaper. The product is an essential oil so no by product for your $. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mirenda

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This product is something that I would never purchase again. When it arrived in the mail, I noticed that a good 30% of the product had either evaporated or was purposely missing from the bottle. It does not smell pleasant. Does not work well to mix with unrefined shea butter. Very low quality in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: CzechMeOut

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine for me. It can be used by itself or in conjunction with other products. Too bad I can't find it in stores!
customer_reviews.author: mystery lover

product_meta.title: Aura Cacia Grapeseed Skin Care Oil | GC/MS Tested for Purity | 118ml (4 fl. oz.)
product_meta.description:
Product Features: 
- Absorbability – Grapeseed oil is fairly stable and nearly odorless. It is notably high in linoleic acid, an essential fatty acid. This contributes to its absorption and weight. 
- Nourishing – Grapeseed oil contains an excellent balance of skin-supporting compounds like oleic, palmitic, and stearic fatty acids. 
- Protecting – Aura Cacia Grapeseed oil is rich in vitamin E, which promotes moisture that protects the skin. 
- Penetrating – Grapeseed oil’s light and absorbent feel makes it an ideal choice for massage as it absorbs quickly. 
- Versatile – Grapeseed oil is lightweight and affordable – it can be used on its own or to dilute other fatty oils. 
- Sustainable – Aura Cacia Grapeseed oil comes from grapes that are thrown away during the wine making process.

Additional Features: 
- 100% Pure Botanical Ingredients 
- No Synthetic Colors or Fragrances 
- Not tested on Animals 
- Paraben & Petroleum Free 
- Non-GMO 
- 4 ounces (118 ml)

Ingredients: 
Vitis vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate (Vitamin E Acetate).

SUGGESTED USES
Quick Tip: Combine 1 tablespoon with 3 drops of rose essential oil for a light facial oil.

Recipe: Eucalyptus Vapor Rub
Description: A penetrating vapor rub 
Ingredients: 
- 12 drops Aura Cacia Eucalyptus Essential Oil
- 12 drops Aura Cacia Lavandin Essential Oil
- 1 oz Aura Cacia Grapeseed Oil
- 1 oz Aura Cacia Jojoba Oil
- 2-oz Aura Cacia Amber Glass Bottle with Writable Label

Directions:
Combine jojoba and grapeseed oils in glass bottle. Add essential oils, replace lid and shake gently until contents are well blended. Into the palm of one hand, dispense a small amount of the mixture and gently rub into targeted areas. Cover with warm towel or heating pad, if desired.
feature_bullets: GRAPESEED OIL - Grapeseed oil (Vitis vinifera) is the ideal lightweight carrier for oily skin but is highly compatible for many skin types.
VERSATILE AND AROMATIC - Grapeseed is a natural choice for those concerned with nut allergies. It also makes an effective natural alternative to petroleum-derived mineral oil.

ETHICALLY MADE - Aura Cacia Grapeseed Oil is not tested on animals, and contains no synthetic colors or fragrances. Aura Cacia Essential Oils and skin care oils are completely paraben and petroleum free.

PURITY TESTING - Gas chromatography mass spectrometry (GC/MS) testing is the primary way to ensure an essential oil is an unadulterated, true botanical. All Aura Cacia essential oils are GC/MS tested.

ABOUT US - Aura Cacia was founded 38 years ago on pure essential oils and true aromatherapy benefits. We partner with suppliers to source high quality botanicals and rigorously test every batch to ensure purity. We then provide premium products with consumer safety at the forefront. And importantly, Aura Cacia is part of a member owned co-op that puts people and planet ahead of profits.
